odli4.question: As well as using the DISCH switch on the Fire Protection panel in the flight deck, an APU fire can be extinguished by discharging the APU fire extinguisher using the APU Ground Control Panel, which is located in a quick release access panel immediately forward and below the APU.

4zsre.question: How many fire extinguisher bottles are fitted for the Cargo compartments?

options.text: 1 fire extinguisher bottle, that can be selected to be discharged into either cargo hold.
2 fire extinguisher bottles, one for forward cargo hold, and one for rear cargo hold.
2 fire extinguisher bottles, 1 rapid discharge bottle and one smaller slow discharge bottle.
1 fire extinguisher bottle that can only be discharged into forward cargo hold.

muj2l.question: What do the 3 green illuminated lights at the bottom right of the engine fire panel indicate?

options.text: Fire warning system test 1 completed satisfactorily.
Fire extinguisher functional test completed satifactorily.
Fire extinguisher test continuity normal.
Fire Switch handles functional test satisfactory.

nf2wlf.question: How can the Fire Warning Bell be silenced?

options.text: Only by pushing the Master FIRE WARN light
The fire warning bell is only silenced once the condition causing the Overheat or Fire warning has been removed.
Pushing Master FIRE WARN light or pushing the BELL CUTOUT switch located on the Overheat/Fire Protection panel.
Pushing the Master FIRE WARN light, or pushing the bell mute button located next to the speaker on the flight deck ceiling.

25grv.question: How might it be possible to determine if the toilet fire extinguisher has been discharged?

options.text: Discharge nozzles changed colour from black to grey and Pressure gauge on fire bottle in the red zone.
Discharge indicator panel above lavatory door illuminated and Temperature indicator placard in lavatory changes colour from white to black.
Discharge nozzles changed colour from black to grey and Temperature indicator placard in lavatory changes colour from white to black.
Steady red light remains illuminated on Lavatory ceiling smoke detector panel after alarm tone has silenced and Lavatory Fire warning illuminated on flight deck.

3k2xai.question: The engines and APU have fire extinguishing systems, but the cargo holds and wheel well have only suppression systems.

tmsmk.question: After pressing the DISCH switch, how long does it take for the cargo fire DISCH light to illuminate to indicate that the Cargo Fire Suppression system has been fully activated?

options.text: 195 minutes.
Up to 30 seconds
Immediately.
Up to 60 seconds.

pf6de.question: Boeing provide the option for 2 Cargo Fire extinguisher bottles to be fitted, one is a rapid discharge bottle which is fully discharged immediately upon pressing the DISCH switch on the Cargo Fire Panel, the second bottle is a slow discharge bottle that is released 1 minute after the discharge of the first bottle, and discharges slowly over several minutes to provide a total of 195 minutes of fire suppression in the cargo holds.  This second slow discharge fire extinguisher bottle is NOT fitted in any Ryanair B737-800 aircraft.

tm5sw.question: What is the effect of pulling up the No1 Fire DISCH switch?

options.text: Closes engine and spar fuel shutoff valves, closes inlet valve to both Air Conditioning Packs, trips IDG control relay, arms both Squibs on both on both engine fire bottles, and allows the DISCH switch to be rotated left or right.

Closes engine fuel shutoff valve, closes engine bleed air valve, trips IDG control relay, closes hydraulic fluid shutoff valve and isolates EDP low pressure warning light, disables thrust reverser, arms Squib on No1 engine fire bottle, and allows the DISCH switch to be rotated to the left to discharge bottle into N01 engine.

Closes engine and spar fuel shutoff valves, closes engine bleed air valve, trips IDG control relay, closes hydraulic fluid shutoff valve and isolates EDP low pressure light, disables thrust reverser, arms one Squib on both engine fire bottles, and allows the DISCH switch to be rotated left or right.
Extinguishes Master Caution and Fire Warning lights, silences Fire Warning Bell, shuts down No1 engine, and discharges No1 Fire Bottle into No1 engine.

sq2mv.question: The engines have both Overheat and Fire warnings, the APU, cargo holds and wheel well have ONLY Fire warnings.

kn7d9.question: The picture below shows that there is a fault in the left engine Overheat/Fire Detection Loops.  How would you determine which of the 2 loops had failed?

options.text: This indication only occurs when BOTH loops have failed.
Carry out the test again one loop at a time using the OVHT DET switch selected to A and then B.
Carry out the test again with the switch selected to FAULT/INOP testing each loop individually with the OVHT DET switch at A then B.
Move to FAULT/INOP - OVHT/FIRE switch to the central TEST position, then test one loop at a time using the OVHT DET switch selected first to A and then B.

x9bsi.question: The Engine Fire DISCH switches are mechanically locked in the Down position and can only be pulled Up when an Overheat or Fire is detected and the switch has illuminated.
